titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Nathan T. Porter, Jr. Collection of Bookplates by Edwin Davis French
Porter (Nathan T., Jr.) Collection of Bookplates by Edwin Davis French
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Molly E. Dotson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:04

did.unittitle: Nathan T. Porter, Jr. Collection of Bookplates by Edwin Davis French
did.abstract: The collection comprises close to 200 bookplates designed by Edwin Davis French, which were collected by Nathan T. Porter, Jr.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also the Pearson-Lowenhaupt Collection of Bookplates by Edwin Davis French (Call # BKP 49) and Edwin Davis French: A Memorial; His Life, His Art by Ira Hutchinson Brainerd, published in 1908 (Call # Bookplate Z996 F73 (LC)). In addition, several titles bearing the bookplate of Nathan T. Porter, Jr. can be found in the collections of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library and the Elizabethan Club.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Yale Bookplate Collection was formerly housed in Sterling Memorial Library. The collection was incorporated into the Arts of the Book Collection in 1984 and then moved to the Seeley G. Mudd Library in 1990. In 2011, it was transferred to the Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Nathan T. Porter, Jr. Collection of Bookplates by Edwin Davis French, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nathan Todd Porter, Jr. (1867-1947) was a dry goods commission merchant born in Brooklyn, NY. He graduated from Yale, Class of 1890. He worked for Porter Brothers & Co., located in New York, NY, and lived in Montclair, NJ. He married Caroline Chester Knickerbocker in 1892; they had two daughters: Helen and Caroline. He was also a member of the University Club and a trustee of the Montclair Free Public Library.

Edwin Davis French (1851-1906) was a designer and engraver born in North Attleboro, MA. In 1876 he moved to New York, NY, and he worked as a silver engraver and designer for Frank M. Whiting & Company until 1894. He also studied at the Art Students League. French became focused on copper engraving and designed his first bookplate in 1893. In 1897 he moved to Saranac Lake, NY, and he produced over 300 bookplate designs between 1893 and his death in 1906.
Leonard, John W., ed. Who's Who in New York City and State . 3rd ed. New York: L. R. Hamersly & Company, 1907.
Brainerd, Ira Hutchinson. Edwin Davis French: A Memorial; His Life, His Art . New York: privately printed [De Vinne Press], 1908.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises close to 200 bookplates designed by Edwin Davis French, which were collected by Nathan T. Porter, Jr. In addition to bookplates, the collection also contains another example of engraved illustration by French, namely a small reproduction of Jean-François Millet's The Sower , which was used as the imprimatur of author and publisher William Loring Andrews.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Bookplates – Mounted. II. Bookplates – Unmounted. III. Other Engravings. IV. Ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains bookplates mounted on gray paper mounts, measuring 10 x 8 inches. The mounts are printed on recto with "No. _______" in the upper right corner and with "Collection of | Nathan T. Porter, Jr. | Montclair, N. J." in the lower left corner. The bookplate mounts are hand-numbered in black ink.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The bookplates are arranged in numerical order by their identification numbers from a published checklist of French's bookplates and other engravings, Edwin Davis French: A Memorial; His Life, His Art , by Ira Hutchinson Brainerd (1908). According to Brainerd, the checklist "follows [French's] notation with the little continuation needed to carry it to completion." This arrangement is roughly chronological, although some earlier bookplates have been appended to the end of Brainerd's checklist (see Box 2, Folder 10).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains unmounted bookplates which were loosely inserted among the mounted bookplates.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These bookplates are unnumbered, although their arrangement follows that of the numerical order of the checklist published in 1908. According to Brainerd, the checklist "follows [French's] notation with the little continuation needed to carry it to completion." This arrangement is roughly chronological, although some earlier bookplates have been appended to the end of Brainerd's checklist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains an unsigned engraving by French that is a small reproduction of Jean-François Millet's The Sower , which was used as the imprimatur of William Loring Andrews.
